Class RectangleA

  • java.lang.Object
    • RectangleA
  • public class RectangleA
extends java.lang.Object
    RectangleA is a class that represents a rectangle whose sides parallel to the x and y axes.
    Version:
    1.0 (25. Nov 2021)
    Author:
    Roy Bachar

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      (package private) byte DEFAULT_SIDE_LENGTH

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      RectangleA​(int w, int h)
      Constructs a new Rectangle with the specified width and height, and South-Western vertex on (0,0).
      RectangleA​(Point p, int w, int h)
      Constructs a new Rectangle with the specified width, height, and a Point object that represents the coordinates of its South-Western vertex.
      RectangleA​(Point sw, Point ne)
      Calculates the width and height of the rectangle based on the NE and SW distances.
      RectangleA​(RectangleA r)

    • Constructor Detail

      • RectangleA

        public RectangleA​(int w,
                  int h)
        Constructs a new Rectangle with the specified width and height, and South-Western vertex on (0,0).
        Parameters:
        w - the width of the rectangle
        h - the height of the rectangle

      • RectangleA

        public RectangleA​(Point p,
                  int w,
                  int h)
        Constructs a new Rectangle with the specified width, height, and a Point object that represents the coordinates of its South-Western vertex. Checks if the accepted width and height are positive and if not, assigns their values to be 1.
        Parameters:
        p - the South-Western vertex of the rectangle
        width - the width of the rectangle
        height - the height of the rectangle

      • RectangleA

        public RectangleA​(Point sw,
                  Point ne)
        Calculates the width and height of the rectangle based on the NE and SW distances.

      • RectangleA

        public RectangleA​(RectangleA r)
